security: Information concerning IRS investigations and potential sources is restricted under JFK Law 11(a), which could compromise ongoing investigations and sources if released.
summary: FBI teletype from the SAC, Los Angeles, to the Director, FBI, providing an update on John Roselli's whereabouts and activities based on neighborhood sources and information shared with a special agent from the IRS.
summary_one_paragraph: On November 1, 1962, the SAC in Los Angeles sent a teletype to the Director of the FBI reporting that neighborhood sources indicated John Roselli was still residing in his Los Angeles apartment. The teletype also mentioned that LA 4268-C was at the Friar-S Club in Beverly Hills on the afternoon and evening of October 31st, but Roselli was not present. Additionally, a special agent from the IRS in Los Angeles was advised, and information regarding IRS matters is restricted under JFK Law 11(a).
title: John Roselli, AKA
sender: SAC, LA (Special Agent in Charge, Los Angeles Field Office )
